snippet: That most prosaic of public furnishings, the New York City park bench has morphed into a blank canvas on which designers, landscape architects and artists have unleashed their fantasies.
abstract: New York City park benches have morphed into a blank canvas on which designers, landscape architects and artists have unleashed their fantasies; park visitors can now enjoy novel designs like wooden chaises roomy enough for two, bar-stool-style perches with river view, communal work stations for laptop users and even hammocks.
lead_paragraph: That most prosaic of public furnishings, the New York City park bench has morphed into a blank canvas on which designers, landscape architects and artists have unleashed their fantasies.

headline.main: Designers Stretch Out Imaginations on Park Benches
headline.print_headline: Designers Stretch Out Imaginations On Benches
